text: —Yes, — said the ruby — she was the best woman I knew. I walked, that was what I agreed to. There are opinions that are like gifts we don't give: they can't be given (like the soft-spoken women). —Was she a brunette? —I asked at last exhausted by the effects of silence, and because I am a sceptic. 'No, it was my wife,' said the tan man. — Thank you, I said. And we continued parapetted in silence, both satisfied with life. FIN
title: Fábula inmoral
author: Fernando Pessoa
